Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for what you pay - it is a 2 1/2 star remember”
Reviews.Author: Meliss_John18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March last year - yes my review is a little delayed. Sorry. The hotel was in a fabulous location and while it is very basic, it was everything we needed. It is only a 2 1/2 star so don't go expected luxury. The room was clean and warm and breakfast was adequate. There were cereals, juices, fresh breads etc. Rooms are of a good size for the price you pay. I hear the single rooms are very small though, so I would recommend upgrading. The lift is not a plus - very small - as are most lifts we saw in Rome. You will most likely have to use the stairs so not ideal if you are on a higher floor. I personally enjoyed being forced t exercise after all that yummy pizza from across the road. Yes the hotel is dated but in my opinion the hotel is very good value. I would return again if I was faced with the same budget :)

Reviews.Title: “Need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Lemonm1951
Reviews.Content: Very central but with exception of Alex the Receptionist/Maison D'Or very very central but aged. treat it as if only a bed and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “never go stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Maria J
Reviews.Content: The only 2 good things about this hotel are its location and price. The hotel itself seemed to me nice, but only until the time when I entered the room. The furniture is shabby, the TV remote control didn't function, the view out of the window was tubes, cigarette stubs and garbage . The wallpapers became obviously dark with time. It was impossible to stay long in the bathroom, as due to absence of shower walls, window or any other means of ventilation the water that remained after I took the shower remained on the floor and made the smell damp. + I had smoking neighbours. The ceiling in the corridor of the 1st floor leaked. The breakfast is poor, don't expect a ham or a decent juice and coffee. The hotel is closed from 2 AM till 5 AM. And every time you leave the room, you have to hand in the key at the reception. And that is why I used to take all my belongings with me, as there was no safe in the room and I was suspicios of the receptionists remembering all the guests. The receptioninsts (an italian man who works in the morning and a palestinian man who works in the evening, unfortunately I don't know their names) are very nice and helpful - THANK YOU GUYS, YOU SAVE THE EXPERIENCE ONE MAY GET OF THIS PLACE! Yes, the hotel is not expensive, yes it has great location, but I will advise everybody who will read my comment not to take these 2 factors for the basis as I did, but to add some money and choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: j-tourne
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good enough for store your baggages and to get rest after a long day around Rome. Don't forget to pack your ear plugs, since the hotel is located in a quite noisy corner of Via delle Quattro Fontane and Via Nazionale. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was mostly sweet cakes, which I don't concider to be good food in the morning. However, there are buns and cheese to get enough energy to make it to some great cafeteria of Rome. Location was very good. When we arrived, we took a metro from Termini to Barberini. It wasn't very pleasant to pull and carry trollies in endless tunnels and stairs. After getting familiar with the neighborhood, it was much more easier to take a 10 minutes walk from the hotel to Termini station. Spanish steps and Fontana di Trevi are not too far away from the hotel. When heading to Pantheon, Forum Romanum or Colosseum you can save your feet by taking a bus 64 or 40 at Via Nazionale to Area Sacra d. Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Samuli208
Reviews.Content: Hotel experience with Zara was definately below what they promise. The air conditioning wasn't working on the first night, which can be an experiene in July. In that room there was couple of other problems. It seemed that the finishing of the deco was partly left undone. For example some panels in the walls were not attached and they kept falling down. Also the here was no other room available for the that night, so we had to wait until next day to get a new room fixed. Anyways, after getting the new room next day we were happy with a cool room that was also a bit bigger than the one day before. Air conditioning worked perfectly and we felt that it was enough of complaining for now. To be honest there would have been lots of things to improve in the second room as well. The floor was cracked in the room and the shower was flooding on the bathroom's floor. There was no other way to prevent it except putting towels on the floor before going to take a shower. We felt that those were minor problems compared to the lack of air conditioning. Room tidiness was in good levels. Housekeeping took care of changing the towels and sheets and cleaning up the room every day. They had also put automatically extra towels in the bathroom to prevent flooding. OItherwise we had mixed feelings what comes to the staff. Changing the room required some serious conversations with the staff. No discounts even of the first night were offered, and one receptionist ended up not even saying hellos after we dared to ask such a thing. Well, after couple of thank yous of the room change brought a some sort of a smile back to his face. Overall the friendliness of the staff seemed to be changing by person to person. The negative enquiries were normally answered by "it's not my fault/responsibility, ask someone else" -attitude. Breakfast was a bit below standard as well. No fresh things whatsoever. Just same dry bread, cakes and cereal with coffee and juice every day. However, we were still happy with the city and had lovely time looking the sights and experiencing the restaurants outside of the hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect. But in Rome it is very easy to get around, and it wouldn't even really matter if you lived close to the Spanish Steps or somewhere else. Through this experience I would not recommend Hotel Zara to anyone, unless the pricing would be way below what other 3 stars ask in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: aandw11
Reviews.Content: The saving grace of this hotel was it's location, just a short walk to the underground and you are within reach of all Romes attractions. The rooms were ok and clean and all that you needed and the sleep was good, however service from the staff was OK and this was the one hotel where I really didn't enjoy the breakfast. Finding the place at night using their instructions was also hard.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be bothered to help with my lost luggage.”
Reviews.Author: HRDahlman
Reviews.Content: I arrived, already challenged by delayed flight, lost luggage, and navigating Rome Termini and the subway. The hotel concierge, though clearly not busy, could hardly be bothered to contact my airline regarding my lost bag. The guy on the second shift was overheard telling the airline (in Italian) that the American, of course, was demanding special attention. The room was the smallest and most unremarkable room of my trip. At least there was air conditioning. The morning coffee was weak. The location was close enough to walk to many major sites and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish breakfast, they keep your room key!”
Reviews.Author: vg10ver
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were made to stay at hotel zara for 1 night because our hotel (Domus Livia) didnt actually have a room for us! The reception was ok, nice enough staff however when we checked in they told us that we have to hand our key in when we leave the hotel at any point so they know if we are in our rooms or not - call me suspicious but it made me paranoid they would be routing through our things when we left our rooms! Because of this we took all our valuables with us which was a pain in the bum when on a city break and needing to walk a lot! The room was very basic and was NOT a double room, the bed was two singles pushed together!! Shower was very annoying it was over the bath and made it impossible not to get water everywhere. Breakfast wasnt worth even getting up for cold tea and coffee, stale bread and croissants which had been dipped in icing! Waitresses face would have cracked if she smiled! Overall pretty poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location and courteous service”
Reviews.Author: hagoela
Reviews.Content: Let's start that the hotel's excellent location - fifteen minutes at the Coliseum and the Spanish Steps, 5 minutes from the Termini train and Venice Palace. Excellent service polite smiling receptionist. Help us to any problem or question. Provides a nice breakfast. The hotel is designed beautiful, picturesque ceilings and antique furniture ... just a feeling Roman. I traveled with my mother - a women trip and the hotel contributed a lot to the experience. The hotel is located on a side street near the main "Nazionale" Street, sympathetic and pleasant area at night to women alone. In summary, the hotel is highly recommended Michal Hagoel, Israel

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: an62
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, near Termini station and all famous places in Rome. Ok, room was a bit small, but good enough for sleeping! Breakfast included mainly sweet cakes, but you can manage with it. Staff friendly. If you do not mind on small things, you can choose this hotel. If you want luxury - go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Rome could do without it”
Reviews.Author: diemblake
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel Zara - Rome on October 7, 2010 in the late afternoon/evening, and from the very beginning it presented a challenge. I am a very budget-minded traveller, and although I had read some rather negative reviews about this hotel, I decided to try it out because of its location (a step away from Via Nazionale, and close to the Spanish Steps, and just about everything else), and also because there were some positive reviews (regarding the location). This hotel does not present well, but if you do not care about aesthetics, then this is no problem. For me, I didn't care. I began to care, when I found out that the elevator (which could hold only one person at a time and his/her suitcase) only went to the third floor, and my room happened to be on the fourth. One elevator ride, and a trip up two flights of stairs, I ended up in front of the door to my room. I opened the door, eager with anticipation to throw my exhausted self unto the bed awaiting me, only to discover that I could not see because of the darkness of the room. After locating and turning on the light, I saw my room in its full glory. It was small, but I expected that. It was narrow, I expected that too. It was truly dark, even with the light on. This I did not expect. I saw there was a standing closet, which had one of its doors missing. I saw that there was a desk with a television on top of it, but no chair. I saw that there was a window (and thanked the gods.) I saw that there was a long horizontal mirror above the desk. I walked to the window, and opened it. I was pleasantly surprised by the view of the patio and an outline of the city of Rome. I turned around to face my room, and sighed. I was in Rome. I looked to my left and saw a smaller room, which I assumed to be the bathroom. Turning on the light, I saw that it too was very small. I expected this. I saw some exposed wires where there should have been a mirror above the sink. I did not expect this. I also did not expect the loud noise that was produced when I turned on the light. I sighed again, and thought to myself, "Well, at least, I am in Rome." I decided to refreshen my make-up, but as it was getting pretty dark, I decided to find the light source by the mirror, so that I could actually see what I was doing. How foolish I was to think that there would actually be light. I went downstairs to the desk attendant to ask if I could have a lamp of some sort to provide the light needed for me to see, and was told no. I sighed again, at least I was in Rome. I decided I didn't need light for a week and would just do my best at the start of the day. The days went on like this, and only got worse. I recognized from the first night that someone else had slept in the bed, but I expected this. What I did not expect was to find the many, many hairs left behind by the person who had last occupied the bed however. I did a lot of sighing. Over the course of the week, I received fresh towels, but the room was never swept. The dust accumalating in the room was only made worse by the staff's insistence on keeping my window open, even after I closed it. Also, I found out to my dismay that I was not allowed to have male visitors as a single woman, because of some belief that I may be prostituting myself (nevermind the fact that I am gay). I was told by an attendant that this was a law in Italy. I had never heard of this before. So, my poor friend (whom I had come to visit me during my visit was told to wait outside while I came downstairs, and was not allowed to help me bring some shopping bags upstairs after I returned. This was all very disappointing, but who was I to interfere with the law of Italy. I sighed again, and decided never return to this hotel. It also did not help that I was frequently talked about by staff, who referred to me as "la negra," to other people even when I was in their presence (the thought was that I didn't understand Italian at all). So, my advice: if you happen to be a Black woman travelling alone in Rome, who does not like dirty hotels, and ill-mannered staff, then do not stay at Hotel Zara. Regardless of location, the grief involved in staying there is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa0668
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel & then reading some of the reviews I was expecting to be very disappointed, but was actually pleasantly surprised. The staff were very pleasant & spoke very good English. The rooms were a good size & very clean. The location was brilliant. We used a map & found the Trevi fountain, & the Spanish steps very quickly. During our 4 day stay we walked everywhere & saw so much. The Colosseum was only 15 minutes walk, & the Vatican was about 20 minutes away. I would definately go back & stay at this hotel, for the price it was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “not great at all”
Reviews.Author: friz038
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night only thank goodness! the hotel was fine on the outside, the reception was a little old, but nobody minds that, the corridors were well air conditioned , and very nicely decorated. However, our room was dull, dank, damp, and possibly dangerous! the air con which looked to be well due a service has a broken switch, which exposed wiring etc, wasnt confident adjusting it at all.though no need to adjust, it just didnt do much at all. the fridge had also got a kicking on the inside, and it didnt keep anything cold either. the beds were filthy under the sheets and one move and you were over the edge! we were plagued with either fleas or mosquitos, and could literally see them land on the bedsheets! I know they are common everywhere in hot months, but i have a distinct feeling they were permanent guests! the furniture was awful, like mismatched junk shop stuff! the headboard was coming away from the wall, as were the sockets, so dodgy! the bathroom was impossible to wash in, a wet room type set up, with a very dirty plug hole covered with a mat, and old shower curtain straight from the 80's! and thats if you could fit into the bathroom in first place! it was tiny! there were at least 70 years of dust on a high ledge and we stayed dressed in bed to avoid getting bitten, or worse injuries from the bedding.And Wet room & broken sockets do not mix well!!! Dangerous!! not safe to leave things like that!! and it was obviously in that condition for ages! Staff were ok, and some effort was made to clean room before we came but not for the faint hearted or those who like their luxury, described as a boutique hotel, im not so sure! however i will say location was good, walking distance to Termini Station & the attractions, lots of places to eat,, seemed safe enough, good shopping etc, but not enough, bit of a re-vamp and a good clean and the place could be fine, but wouldnt ever recommend to anyone at this point!! we didnt even try breakfast, we left as soon as we could - also one point, we asked for a taxi to be booked for the airport run, and we asked price, which seemed a little steep, so we took short walk to train station and the taxi driver quoted half the price!!! grrrrr!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth coming for the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mynameismalena
Reviews.Content: - room was not ready when we arrived -shower was horrible, it was inpossible to wash yourself correctly, water came all over the floor -breakfast concluded mostly of sweet bakery, machine-coffee, horrible juice, the only thing you could eat was cheese, butter and bread -towels were changed every day, unnecessary +/- french balcony very high +staff gave us a good restaurant tip +location good, not too far to walk from Termini

Reviews.Title: “Junk... Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jimberly01
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. Rude people and terrible old rooms poorly maintained. 'Highlights' of our stay: -Arrive on a hot night to a dirty room with no working air-conditioning -'Double' bed actually twin singles pushed together but split during the night leaving a gap -Rude staff who pretended there was no problem until we pressured them -Moved rooms to a room with 'air-conditioning' at about 25C (~77F) -Shower leaked all over the floor -Breakfast was stale and uninspiring

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfectly adequate.”
Reviews.Author: RBMD
Reviews.Content: We returned from an 11-day trip to Italy, not our first time. This hotel is perfectly adequate. It's major "plus" is location -- close to. or within easy walkind distance to most of the major sites, and the bus tothe vatican stops at the corner. If you just need a place to park your belongings and be out most the day, this will be fine. Our room was good size, and the bathroom had been recently modernized: large, with full tub and shower, and with a bidet. We were in the back of the hotel, so it was quiet. The breakfast was very basic. Lots of sweet breads and pastries, but of poor quality. The juice was watered down. The coffee was dispensed from a machine, but was fine. Don't expect major amenities.

Reviews.Title: “city break”
Reviews.Author: avid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central in Rome with approximate 20/30 minutes walk to the colleseum and other atttractions. We had a good sized room with a fridge and tv with one english channel. The bathroom was also a good size with bidetm bath but no plug and shower. The breakfast was cakes and bread but ample coffee and tea from a machine. It is an expensive city and you need to be careful with service charges especially near St Peters.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wilk0243
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel Zara in Rome with my mother. If you're looking for a decent hotel, in a safe neighborhood, that's within walking distance of most major sites, then you couldn't do better than Hotel Zara. It is an older, small hotel, but I found it quite charming, especially when compared to most of the hotels you find in the US. Our room was cleaned daily, and the service desk was extremely helpful when it came to scheduling drivers to and from the airport, recommending restaurants, and even helping me translate my phone card so I could call home. If you're looking for a luxurious 5 star experience, than this hotel is not for you. But personally, I had an amazing experience and could not have asked for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible. Stay ANYWHERE else.”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel should NOT be a three star. It shouldn't have any stars. If we weren't just staying overnight we would have left immediately. The hotel itself is filthy. The room has tiles on the floor. The beds are saggy. The carpet is so dirty and old Ididn't want to put my handbag on the floor. The airconditioning made such a racket that we had to turn it off. The breakfast was a joke. Meagre, stale and no service. Couldn't wait to leave. After sitting down for breakfast we decided to leave and eat elsewhere. Worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment , what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: vegasvancouver
Reviews.Content: It is true, good location but I would highly recommend do not stay in this hotel!!! Not one good thing to say about it, even found the staff unfriendly, the breakfast was terrible, the fridge didnt work, the rooms were incredibly small. We had four of us and they shoved 4 single beds together!!!! It was noisy and the courtyard reeked of garbage. I couldnt wait to tell my travel agent to stop recommending this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ipetsu
Reviews.Content: First I didn't realize how close to everything this hotel was. The street where it was located seemed so small. So, the location was very good, and hotel staff was nice. They had very good tips and helped to get tickets to football game. Breakfast wasn't very good, all sweets. Coffee from machine and cakes. And what comes to the room, it was ok. Bed was big and comfortable but the bathroom could have been more cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travellergirl32 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with my father in Sept 2009 (which I was a bit worried about as European hotel rooms do tend to be small) but I was really impressed with the big room we received at the Zara hotel. It is basic but it is very clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is great -- walking distance from the train station, the subway and the hop-on-hop off tour stops.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - good location, bad hotel and service does not reflect 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: LondonSimpleton
Reviews.Content: No response to the request to clear blockage at the shower. Water was taking a long time to drain out. The man at the reception on the first day we checked in had the bloody cheek to tell me “you cannot turn on the shower fully, only half if not the bathroom will flood” which reflects poor customer service. Condition of shower is not up to mark compared to a 3 star hotel – there are chip and crack marks on the shower floor area. The borders are black – indicating that it is not cleaned properly. The shower curtain is quite old (with the edges fraying and spots on the curtain) and needs changing. Poor condition of the basin – the cup has stains inside, the basin has deep scratches on it, the cup holder is cracked, the mirror has stains inside it. The antiquated central Air conditioning system in the room not cold enough .It is just slightly cooler compared to the scorching heat outside. At night, the air con is so loud – it could wake you up from your sleep. The carpets condition in the hotel is a real turn off. Certain parts are really worn down and dirty and it looks as though it has not been vacuumed for months. The condition of the furniture at the bar is really poor. The cushion on the sofa is so worn down – it sunked down at the centre by a few inches. Service of staff – the lady at the reception did not even bother to tell us that the elevator is in front when she saw us lugging our luggage up the stairs. That was really unhelpful. The condition of most of the rooms is quite bad . My friends room was really bad - the shower is not working you need to get them to fix or the air conditioning is really bad . He changed room and said the condition of the new room is slightly better than previously. The furniture in the room is quite alright even though it is old, however the condition of the room is below that of a 3 star hotel. Tiled floors, and wall paper not properly stuck on, dirt of the air con vent. Would not visit again. For €60 / night - Rome standard -considered alright for the location. But frankly, I rather pay more for a better room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: eventSecurity
Reviews.Content: the location for this hotel was perfect. you can walk to any major attraction in rome. its a nice clean hotel, but the rooms are very small. like they are tiny, there isnt much room at all. but you dont stay in a room long in rome, you head to the sights, you just sleeps there is suppose. they dont have a safety deposit box though, so it meant we had to lock our stuff in our cases and take the keys with us. wasnt too happy about that breakfast is just cakes it seems, not really that nice its no the best hotel you could stay in, but for location and price, it is great

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pit620
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location we could ask for. I have been in Rome two times before this trip but this time I have a feeling that we were within a 5 min walk from anything you could wish to see in Rome, except Vatican. Everything we've planned to visit was in walking distance from the hotel. Even our visit to Vatican was on foot since on the way from hotel to Vatican you can see so many things that it is better to walk than to take metro. The only problem with the room we had, was bad A/C so it was a bit hot. It was on the 4th floor and the elevator goes to 3rd but it was very quiet. The bathroom was great, nice size and we had hot water all the time with good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: Cristhin82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close (10 minutes walk) to Termini Railway Station, but nothing more than that. Although it was clean, the room was really hot, there was no air conditioning and it was located on the forth floor, but the elevator only reached the third floor. The bathroom was really a poor and small one, with a weird shower (no curtains and no "shower structure", just a tap pouring water all over the bathroom). The price per night is not acceptable for such poor facilities.

Reviews.Title: “no hot water when full”
Reviews.Author: UkToast
Reviews.Content: Water freezing cold on our first night barely tepid thereafter. Manager refused to adjust our bill because he felt this was caused by the other customers using water and therefore beyond his control. Good location but don't expect to shower!

Reviews.Title: “great location, fair price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bubbamomma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Italy. Stayed at the Hotel Zara for three nights. Nice room at the back of the hotel so it was quiet. Supermarket up the street and a resturant next door. We got sandwiches to go everyday plus cheese and meats. You can purchase you bus/metro tickets at the resturant. Helpful staff, good breakfast (included in price) can't beat the location. 15 min. walk to most attractions. Would definately stay again. Flushingcat

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthIslandKiwis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off a main road so our room was quiet. We arrived early and left our luggage at the hotel whilst we went to the Trevi Fountain (15 mins walk away) until our room was ready. Staff were very helpful. They booked a night bus tour and airport taxi for us. Room was clean. Breakfast nice. Colosseum is 20 mins walk away. Good restaurants around. Self service laundry 8 mins walk away. Not too bad. Stayed 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gform
Reviews.Content: Situated in an excellent location, very central. Staff is friendly and helpful and rooms are of a reasonable size and clean. Comfortable bed. Would recommend the hotel but it has some disadvantages. Breakfast is very limited and we were a bit shocked unitl we got used to it. The room was a bit warm and we had to sleep with the window open since it was not possible to set the AC to a cooler temperature. The hotel advertises a 24 hour reception but in fact it closes during the early morning hours (although this did not affect us).

Reviews.Title: “Grimy and awful location”
Reviews.Author: lisaaw
Reviews.Content: This place was soulless! I stayed at another place the other nights (Marta gusethouse - fantastic!) as I had only booked the initial night till I got over jetlag. It is central - but - that area between the Spanish steps and the main rail station Termini - is awful! Very busy with traffic, tourists and noisy. I was travelling alone, and found it a lonely place to stay. There were a few middle aged travellers and very quiet. My room was a single bed in a narrow space with a not very functional bathroom. the view of grimy old wall from room ws not nice at all. The street leading along to the Spanish steps was narrow, dingy and noisy. You can stay elsewhere that is a lot nicer for less I am sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: justjac77
Reviews.Content: Trust me. Spend the money to stay somewhere else. The man at the front desk could NOT have been more horrible to me. When I told him I lost my confirmation email he looked at me with such disgust that I almost left the hotel. The rooms are tiny and dirty, the bathroom is unkept, the beds are hard. I would have gladly paid 50 more Euro to be treated with respect. Do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and VERY friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: frannie60
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend who had stayed there previously. It is in a very great location of Rome. The Via Nazionale, which is close to the train station, close to a pharmacy and walking distance to many sights. We took the tour bus (hop on and hop off) not too far from this hotel. The rooms were of decent quality, although I found all the beds in Rome felt like straw, spoiled I guess. The bathroom was very organized, fairly new and very clean with lots of running hot water and good water pressure. I recommend this hotel . There are others, but the front desk staff (they are all brothers) are most helpful and honest. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel if you want to spoil your holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Koule
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small, the hotel is very expensive for the services and quality of accommodation that it offers, particularly in comparison with four star hotel located directly opposite (which is in fact cheaper). In addition the night staff are particularly unfriendly, so when you come back form dinner you have to deal with unfriendliness bordering rudeness of the night guard. (there is no 24 hours reception and if you come back late you constantly feel you have to apologise).

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Peach21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a pleasant stay overall. The check-in and check-out process was smooth. We had to leave the room key with reception when going out but this is common practice with Italian hotels. Continental breakfast - self service buffet of a good standard: unlimited hot drinks (the hot chocolate was delicious!!). There were cereals, bread rolls, cakes, croissants - plain and chocolate, cheese and jams. The breakfast room is lovely, bright and welcoming. Room - Air conditioning and fridge did not work. Bed was rock hard and we were certain that there were bed bugs in the sheets. The white sheets were clean but the green cover-spread did not look or feel clean. Bathroom - was spacious and clean. Location - very good for buses going to Colosseum and Vatican, but you need to get tickets from metro station first which is a 5 minute walk up the road. Hotel is in walking distance to Trevi Fountain (a bit of a hill to come back). Hotel is close to Termini Station (about 15 mins walk) Be sure to go down Nazionale Road from the station for the quickest route. There is a Spa supermarket and pharmacy near by. The downside to the location is there aren't many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. My husband and I stayed at this hotel on a tight budget. We really liked the location as a base to explore the city, and enjoyed the continental breakfast. The downside was the room we had. The bed and bed linen was well below average, but as we were only in our rooms late at night and left to go sightseeing early in the morning, it was bearable. We would recommend this hotel for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing the sites”
Reviews.Author: K&L07
Reviews.Content: Great location, about a 5 minute walk to Republica Metro, and 10 minutes to Termini. We walked pretty much everywhere, but caught the metro to Vatican City. We stayed for 3 nights in a double room which comprised of 2 singles. The beds were extremely hard! Bathroom was essentially a shower room, very small, and in desperate need of renovating. The air con was good however, it wouldn't work one night so we found it quite uncomfortable. The in-room safe was a lock up compartment within the wardrobe (I think, as it's the only thing that we found with a lock on it) but the lock was broken. So we locked up valuables in our bags. There were renovations taking place on part of the building which our room looked out on. Breakfast was quite basic, croissants, bread rolls, cheese, juice and coffee and tea. We only had breakfast 1 out of the 3 days and found grabbing a coffee on the street was much better. Overall, decent for the price you pay, but just a basic 3 star hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Isapooh
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great ... but if you arrive via bus, be prepared to haul your luggage up the hill on a very narrow and uneven sidewalk! The rooms are small but clean ... and the staff is very friendly and helpful at any time (reception personnel were very well versed in English). They helped with our luggage, offered maps, arranged bus tickets, taxi cabs, etc. If you want to stay in Rome for only a few days and see the sights of he city... this is a great location (just don't expect the North American comforts for the price you pay!)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: anoilc
Reviews.Content: It really is in a great location and that is basically all you are paying for. We stayed there 4 nights last week and our sheets were not changed once - granted they were clean when we arrived and made up every day but not changed. Small things like no shampoo etc and also 1 roll of toilet roll for the whole time were disappointing - especially when the price of the place is considered. We went to breakfast at 9.20am one morning (it ends at 9.30) and we were turned away so that was frustrating. Not even a bread roll was available. It was safe and the staff were friendly though so it was perfectly adequate for a hotel in which to base yourself if you are to be out all day.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Buck29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Zara the last week of February for two nights. The location is great...a short walk from Termini Station after taking the train in from airport. About 1/2 block off Via Nationale, you can walk to all the major sites and there is plenty of shopping/eating/history quite close. We stayed on Floor 2. THE GOOD: Room was clean, bathroom was good sized, front desk staff was outstanding, breakfast was adequate compared to my other hotel breakfast experiences in Italy, room was quiet when you closed the window (no traffic noise). THE BAD: Beds were rock hard, awoken by smoking the first morning at 7 am. In all, it is a solid budget hotel for Rome and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up in a triple with a double bed and a single one off to the side, definitely surprised to see how big it was. We were in room 106 on the 2nd floor. The room seemed a little worn down, like there were chips on the tiles in the bathroom, the AC and the fridge didn't work, but didn't bother us too much. There was a huge step you need to leap over to get into the bathroom though: I stubbed my toe the first time I walked into the bathroom, so be careful! The bed was very lumpy too, pain for my hips and back in the morning. There is a tiny TV and a good sized wardrobe which we didn't really use. Breakfast is in a nice room ornately decorated (same floor) with an assortment of breads and cereal and drinks. The front desk was very warm and friendly. Some friends of ours had come by our hotel a few times asking for us before we arrived and he seemed very hospitable every time, as we were told by our friends. There is a lift in the hotel, but SO slow. Since we were on the second floor, the long straight staircase suited us just fine. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the train station and centrally located to the major sites. The only big issue we had with our room was that it was next to the bar and breakfast rooms so in the morning, we heard so much clanging. So, a few things I could change, but overall an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well within expectation of visiting a capital”
Reviews.Author: liapa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March of 2006. By European standards (capitals!) it was great for the price and the expectations and I would definitely go here and only here again. 1) ideal location! minutes from piazza Barberini (where you can find the famous Fontana del Tritone), you can walk! to Termini station (5 minutes), you can take a bus on Via Nazionale ( one block!) to anywhere a tourist may want to go in Rome , maximum 10 minutes walk to Phanteon... 2) nice hosts (a family-run business) 3) relative spacious room, but more importantly spacious and very clean bathrooms (a real paradize after a tiring walks around the city) . I think most, if not all, rooms are renovated. Downsides: breakfast will bore you after a few days, but there are a few coffee places nearby. Few recommendations: - do not leave your valuable stuff unattended. while we didn't loose anything, there were no safe deposits and our belongings were rearranged as the cleaning personal deemed convenient (not with the intent to organize it for your convenience). it made us feel uneasy. - whatever you need (missing towels, soaps etc), make sure you don't argue! or else your stay will be miserable. we witnessed few unfortunate ones and read a few reviews. Our stay was very fine in that sense while we were able to get our way! - DON"T COUNT on the hotel to tell you of time change or anything of that matter. you are on your own! we almost missed a plane because we didn't know they were changing time in Europe that day.

Reviews.Title: “great location but.........”
Reviews.Author: niamh28
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is in a really good central part of rome however how it is a 3 star hotel is beyond me. We stayed in room 364 was was without doubt the tinest hotel room ever. the beds are unbelievably hard. very shappy furniture although they are clean. the shower was also absolutely tiny. there was no lock and the door handle was threatening to come away from the door any time you touched it. I would recommend staying in the via nationazle area however as it is very central and close to metro/ train station etc

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mickums
Reviews.Content: The location is this hotel's strong point - within walking distance of Termini station and all the main sights. Just off Via Nazionale which is a good shopping street too. We found it good value for a city centre hotel. Although somewhat shabby, it is clean. The lift works (though only goes to the third floor and we had to walk up one flight of stairs to our room on the top floor - hardly a major problem though). The room was spacious enough and the twin beds interesting - one soft and one hard - suited us perfectly!. The breakfast was predictably boring but Ok being included in the price. The weather in early November was surprisingly cold at night and we couldnt get any heat in the room - the aircon/heater(?) looked very antiquated and the radiator didnt seem to work at all. On the top floor we actually had our own outside terrace though the view wasn't exactly auspicious (back streets).

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDavies
Reviews.Content: Clean and in a great central location is about all I can say about this hotel. The staff do just enough that you can't class them as rude, but they certainly do nothing that allows you to think that they are helpful too! The rooms are very dated and in need of modernisation (very 1970's bathroom and 1980's bedroom). The most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept in. There was no give in the mattress at all! Lift was out of order for most of the time we were there and as we were on the 3rd floor and I was travelling with a parent who struggles to climb the stairs this was a bit of an issue. Certainly would recommend staying in the Quattro Fontane area, but not this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Zara met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: flyboytoo
Reviews.Content: The location and cost were factors that swayed my decision to stay at the Zara. We arrived at 8.00am and the staff kindly allowed us to check our baggage and go touring while we awaited our check-in time later in the day. The staff were marvellous - very friendly & helpful. The breakfast met our needs & there is a great little restaurant just around the corner. The room was small but typical 3 star european size and my only complaint was the firm bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good during the morning, not so good at night”
Reviews.Author: dlustig
Reviews.Content: Let me brake this down so it is simple and to the point: 1- We got to Zara and were pleased with the person working at the lobby since he was extremely friendly and professional. 2- The first room we got was room 112- here is were the problems begin. a- Air conditioner DOES NOT WORK - it is not so great to be in Rome in the middle of a very hot summer without AC b- Mattresses were absolutely awful- The mattresses were very hard, there was no way we could sleep in a mattress that was harder than the actual floor c- The bathroom was tiny- the shower was literally on top of the sink, so you could brush your teeth while taking a shower looking yourself at the mirror. The water also would go everywhere and it smelled moldy 3- At night, after we walked around Rome and had a nice dinner by Campo di Fiori, we walked back to the hotel. The walk was not that bad since the location of the hotel was very good. 4- Terror reigns the night at this hotel, the person who works at the desk during the late night shift is nothing but an innappropriate, unfriendly, unpolite individual. It was almost like we were not in the same hotel. I must say, this guy is very different to all of the italian that I met during my trip. 5- Next day we were switched over by the nice guy who took care off us the previous day to a new room. Room 116 a- AC working- nice and cool room b- They soften the mattress for us with sheets c- The bathroom was actually more normal, with a normal shower and did not smell like mold Overall, my stay was a 50-50 at this hotel Hope that you can make your decision from this review, and remember if you go to Zara, ask them to soften your beds and to give you any other room other than 112.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Imbiber5350
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the begining of June and found that the Hotel was just right for our needs. The room was big enough as was the bathroom though the wash basin was missing its plug. The breakfast room is very nice even if the breakfast was the usual continetal buffet. It is in easy walking distance of all the main attractions. If going further the metro is only 5 minutes walk away and the bus stop is only a minutes walk away. The person who reccommended the two restaurants Esti Esti Esti at the cul de sac end of via Genova and the La Taverna dei Monti on via del Boschetto both off the via Nazionale has my sincere thanks for telling us about two great reasonable priced eating places. If in Rome again we would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying at Hotel Zara”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our wedding in Rome on 27th May and honeymoon in Sorrento, Italy. We (and 18 of our wedding party) stayed in Hotel Zara, Via Quattro Fontane in Rome. Bino, Gino and Enzo (representatives from Hotel Zara) could not have been more helpful in terms of organising accommodation for the wedding party, taxi's and general tourist information. The hotel rooms were spotlessly clean, breakfast was basic continental but enough to kick-start your day. The Hotel was so central to all the main sites, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. I would definitely recommend Hotel Zara as a Hotel which is good value in terms of cost per night, friendly staff and great location. Bino, Gino and Enzo, thank you so much for your assistance and kindess to Jim and I and our families and friends during our recent stay at your Hotel. Much appreciated. We will return. We held our wedding reception at a restaurant called Il Vineria Il Chianti, Via Lavatore (located close to the Trevi Fountain). Giovanni and his staff took great care of us and we had a fabulous relaxed reception at this restaurant. We would highly recommend the food and service at this Restaurant. Carmel Keane, Co Clare, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NickD73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zara for 5 nights. We paid 150 euro per night. Not cheap in my book, especially for what we got. Reading some of the more recent reviews made me wonder if we stayed in the same hotel.. The booking confirmation said we had booked a room with city views and a king size bed. When we checked in we were given a room with a view of the run down back of the adjacent building, and two single beds made up as a double. We weren't that concerned, but when we queried it we were told that no rooms had a city view, and all of them had the same beds... so basically that the confirmation was a complete fabrication. The room was not big, but wasn't cramped either. It had next to no soundproofing.. you could hear people in the hall as if there was no door. The bathroom was very dated, but reasonably clean. When I asked if the airconditioning in the room worked, I was told that we weren't supposed to use it, and that the only way I could control the temperature was by turning off the heat if we were too hot. There was no way of cooling other than opening the window. Someone else here commented on the beds and they were spot on... they were so hard it was almost like sleeping in the floor.. I swear I actually had bruises. If we weren't so tired from walking all day I probably wouldn't have slept at all. The breakfast room was very pleasant and bright, but the breakfast itself was pretty ordinary.. we both laughed at the processed cheese slices that were put out (still in their plastic wrappers). We sat down for breakfast on the first morning but didn't stay. We found the breakfast at the bar around the corner on Via Nazionale was much better, and less than 10 euro for two people. The same bar makes great pizza and cocktails incidentally. I can't remember the name but it's near the supermarket and bus stop. What took the cake though, was when, on the morning we were checking out, we got up to shower at about 6:45am. At about 7:00 the concierge rang to tell us that our toilet cistern must have been stuck because he could hear the water going constantly and it was "making so much noise that it was disturbing the other guests". When I explained that it wasn't the cistern, but the shower, and that we were actually using it.. he told us that we should get out of the shower because it was too loud!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy yourself”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Zara at the beginning of March. Looked very shabby from the outside and after entering their miniscule reception and checking in found ourselves in a rather snug double room on the third floor. The bathroom was interesting to say the least in that it would be better called a wet room. Approx 1meter square it had everything including a handy light switch and hair dryer within reach of the shower which you were beneath whilst stood at the hand basin!(you actually pulled a plastic curtain around yourself to contain the spray)This rather inauspicious start to our stay however must not put you off this hotel. The price for a superb location was very very good value, the room was spotlessly clean, it was very quiet at night, the large double bed was comfortable,the room was beautifully warm,as was the water in the basin and the shower.The fridge had a good range of drinks at reasonable prices, the telly worked fine,the staff were always pleasant and the cold buffet breakfast was adequate taken in a lovely bright room. Shame the bar was not open at night but I assume it was because we were out of season. I would recommend without hesitation this hotel as a place to stay. We walked everywhere from this hotel and don't forget we are in our 60's and got back to the Zara every night tired but happy. One of the most interesting places to eat is just down the road called Esti Esti Esti. Down a dark back street at the end -look it up and enjoy!Another one to enjoy is La Taverna dei Monti in the via del Boschetto-again just down the road. Beautifully cooked food and reasonable prices. We saw all the sights in our 4 day stay but felt we only scratched the surface of this wonderful vibrant city.We hope to return to chuck a coin in the Trevi!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinIrelandOlive
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay at hotel Zara from the 17th of Feb for four nights. We were very impressed with this hotel, the staff are very friendly & helpfull, the location could not be better, great for shopping & walking distance to most of the major sites. Our double ensuite room was very nice, clean towels & bed made up every day. Buffet breakfast had everything you expect. We will definetly stay at this hotel when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen16
Reviews.Content: Big rooms in an old building, very handy location, well priced, breakfast is a bit basic. Try the wine bar around the corner for a good, cheap meal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Zara - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room in Hotel Zara for three nights. --> I travelled to Roma where a close friend, whom I had not seen for many months, agreed to meet me. The plan was to explore the Eternal city together over a long weekend. So when she suggested Hotel Zara, I was somewhat apprehensive because of the multitude of average or negative reviews on this site. And furthermore, the pictures on the website suggested a hotel a little too grand for my taste - and all at 90 euros per night? Mmmmm. But we went ahead regardless - as the location seemed superb. And in a city such as Roma, a hotel is merely somewhere to sleep and to possibly breakfast.. right? Wrong. Over the course of the weekend, I learnt that you can reliably measure the quality of any 3-star hotel by the extras the staff will provide to create the experience you've travelled there for. Especially on a weekend such as ours where excessive rain threatened the banks of the Tiber! Having walked in the rain from Termini (<15mins), I was pleasantly surprised by the warmth of Gino, at the reception - who, luckily for me, spoke perfect English and informed me that my friend had arrived early and was allowed to wait for me in our room. There was lift to the third floor where both our bedroom and adjoining bathroom were spacious, heated and clean. The effort that had gone into the decor was obvious - the type of room one could feel comfortable in during any season. Over the course of the weekend, I noted many small things that were done to make our stay a more pleasant one. Example..? The staff were flexible enough to bring us a late breakfast in bed, without hesitation. My friend had the onset of flu, and I was informed this service was not the norm..! Even having a corkscrew at hand -- a sign of an experienced staff prepared for any eventuality! On my last night, the weather having improved somewhat, I took a stroll down the road to the Spanish steps - my friend had already left. But this centrality proved so important for us during the weekend. My last stay in Roma was at the 4-star Starhotel in San Pietro (evidently, a hotel I decided not to return to). Next time, I will return to Hotel Zara - with it's staff an asset of which they should be proud. I had asked the hotel to arrange a lift to the airport. When I arrived downstairs at 07:25 with my luggage, I was surprised to be told that my driver was early and waiting for me in the dining room. We had an espresso together and on the way to Ciampino, with his beautiful music selection, he struggled in English (and in very slow Italian) to communicate the important sites I might have missed, the traffic into Roma on a Monday morning... and even how he is learning Japanese from his wife. So if you're looking for a 3-star hotel with a 5-star service, (where the staff actually remember you by name), I'd say look no further, and remember.. you're paying a decent rate by Roman standards for one of the best locations and by far the best hotel service that this well-travelled student has experienced. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: classmaz
Reviews.Content: My star rating is based on the hotel being a budget hotel. I ended up paying £80 each for flights and accommodation for 2nights. I have to say the hotel was good value for money. We had clean towels every day and beds were made every day that was a big thumbs up. The location of the hotel is ideal, breakfast was a bit weak but what can you expect for that price. I give the Zara thumbs up, as you couldn't get any hotel in London for the same price/spec. hope this can be a help for other people. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Not the single room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Zara Hotel in Rome. I was in a single room. The room was so narrow that I measured it. It was 73" wide. The bed was hard as a rock, and was narrower than the average north american single bed of 39". The room was fairly clean. The one bright spot was the staff - they were extremely helpful and friendly. The dining room is lovely, complete with chandeliers, and the breakfast was very good. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a single room. Friends of mine had a double room, and while being small, it was adequate. Carol Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sjf123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Zara for 3 nights. The hotel is located at the corner of Via Nazionale and Via Quottro Fontane, which is a 15 minute walk to the Colliseum and Roman Forum. The Repubblica metro station is about 5 minute walk away. This hotel is definely a 3 star, but I was very happy with it. The room was nicely decorated and included an ensuite bathroom, mini fridge and tv. The room rate also included a continental breakfast that was sparse although acceptable. I found the front desk staff very helpful and friendly, and patiently answered any questions I had. It was a perfect spot for seeing Rome and I would recommend it. Please remember that this is not a luxury hotel but is a very good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel Zara for four nights. On the website it looked like decent three star accomodation in the centre of Rome however this was not the case. On arrival our room was not ready so we asked to leave our baggage so that we could go out for the day. We had to leave our cases on the landing of the main staircase in full view of anyone passing the hotel - hardly very secure. When we arrived back at the hotel we were told we were on the 4th floor, however the lift only went as far as the third so we had to struggle through the corridors and up two flights of stairs with our cases. The stair carpet was stained and there were wires hanging out of the walls where the light fittings should have been. Our room was not much better. It was small, dark and dingy, there were dirty marks on the walls and the wallpaper was peeling off. Only two of the three lights worked and on the first night one of those broke! Beyond the bedroom was a small hallway which had a cupboard containing a filthy blanket and a window with a loose electrical wire hanging outside it. The bathroom was small, the toilet was not clean, there were electircal wires loose on the windows and the mirror which should have had three lights in it had one bulb which didn't work, one fitting with no bulb in it and one hole where a fitting should have been. All in all our experience was so awful that we left Rome two days early as we could not bear to stay in the hotel any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there on the 21 of July and I considered it to be reasonable for the money... It´s not a great hotel viewed from the outside, but the people are pleasant and helpful... The bedrooms are OK, but could be a lot better, related to higiene... I rate it **

Reviews.Title: “Hideous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is nasty. Rooms are small and not very clean. AC barely works and TV was kaput. Bed was like sleeping on a sheet of cardboard. I thought maybe that was what you got in rome for 200 bucks till we checked into the Hotel Metropolitani (not sure about spelling) 10 days later. Same price, beautiful Lobby, huge rooms, bar on 10th floor overlooking rome. SAME PRICE! On the plus side, I saw alot of Rome due to we did not want to go back to our room. Dont stay here look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Been here twice now - good value/good location”
Reviews.Author: Debray25
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have been to Rome twice now and each time stayed at the Hotel Zara. The main reason we have selected this hotel has been based on location. You'll be hard pushed to find a more reasonably priced hotel that also allows you to go to any of the attractions (and trust me there are plenty to visit) and they are all within walking distance. The Vatican is about the furthest away a 20 minute stroll taking in all the sights along the way! The accomodation was clean granted not 5 star rating but I feel people need to consider the amount they are spending on the hotel when selecting it. Not a honeymoon choice but definately a great weekend base with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: chee8218
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Zara two weeks ago. We had 3 triple and 1 double rooms for 2 nights. Though early check in was not granted but the front desk allowed us to check in 1 room at the 1st floor. When we returned, the front desk informed that they have given us 4 rooms on the same floor (4th floor) and luggage has been removed to the 4th floor. Quite a surprise to us after reading all the negative feedback from the TripAdviser! The 4th floor has no lift. The lift served up to 3rd floor and to walk up for another floor. However, the lift is really tiny and accomodate not more than 5 persons. Breakfast is very simple. Not a fanstastic spread.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Zara
HotelInfo.Address: Via Delle Quattro Fontane 37, 00184 Rome, Italy
